page.title: 08EPPLETON PARISH CHURCH
page.content: A brick-built late{Victorian {Church}topped by a gilded {weather-cock.}The church is full of brightly coloured stained glass windows, tapestry kneelers, banners and paintings, much of this work made by members of the congregation. The Vicar, Rev. John Stephenson, is very involved with the{Peace } {Movement}and the Church magazine; much of the art work and the hymns sung reflect this. The Church's close links with the mining community are shown by the display of the{Lodge banner}and {miners' lamps.
